item.description:
The Ossipee Range is a 9-mile wide circular wilderness that rises 2000'-3000' directly above Lake Winnipesaukee.  Views of the lake, the White Mountains, and the surrounding countryside are absolutely outstanding.  Many of the trails pass through the grounds of Castle in the Clouds, an Arts & Crafts-style estate owned by the Lakes Region Conservation Trust (LRCT).

Our route, from the upper parking area north to Mount Roberts, will bring us through scrub-oak forest, and across several ledges with beautiful views. Trails vary from wide, flat carriage roads to rocky and steep.

This will be a moderate hike with a couple of possible turning-back points if the group wants a shorter trip.

If we go the whole way, the elevation gain is 1350’ - Distance: 5.5 mi r/t - Time: 4 hours.

Carpool: 8:45 AM @ Dover CJ Trailways Park & Ride. Take Spaulding Tpk/Rt 16 north to Exit 9 - Left @ light - then Left @ 2nd light.

Trailhead: Follow RT 16 north to RT 171 (~36mi from Dover exit 9). Turn LEFT & follow RT 171 for 14 miles. Ossipee Park Rd enters on the right about 1.5 mi past the entrance to Castle in the Clouds. Follow Ossipee Park Rd for 1.5 mi to the parking area just outside the gate. Drive time from Dover is ~65 minutes.  We'll be at the trailhead at ~10:15am.

Food: Bring something to eat for the hike but we can also stop at the Poor People's Pub on the way home. It's a very friendly place on RT 109 in Sanbornville that we found after a snowshoe a couple of years ago.

Pets: No dogs on this hike, please.

Liability Release - AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Ossipee Range: Mount Roberts
